The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?

Comments_List: I learned interest rates and how to do applications that I can use in real life.
I learned how not to ask "how do I solve this" and started looking at questions as "what do I know?"
I learned how to problem solve a lot better and different more efficient ways to go about a problem.
Using math skills and applying them to real world situations.
I developed the ability to put the use of different math concepts into real-world problems.
I learned how to do some good calculations that will be helpful with my adulthood such as mortgage payments and compound interest.
A lot of the material we learned about was unlike anything I had learned about in math in high school. It gave me a new perspective about the use of math.
Learning how I can apply certain mathematical concepts to real world issues
reinforced a lot of fundamental concepts I had learned in the past.
I learned how to think through problems better and set them up in a way that makes them easier if you don't know how to attack it
More open to questions
Strengths was that I found the review sessions before the tests very helpful.
I loved taking the course and would recommend it.
The course material is very manageable but the course instructor was often lost and would not explain things very well.
The ability for the teacher to guide students could be improved. His usual response to questions is I dont understand what you are asking.

I think the material was not that difficult but the way we were taught made it very complicated and make it hard to learn. I think the way the Professor conveyed the ideas was fun and engaging sometimes but he would get confused and it was hard to volunteer.
I think it would be useful to cover less topics and focus better on some of the more intricate and confusing ones.
textbook/communication was a little tough
Class just sits there and watches, no engagement.
Yes. Helps in life
Yes it is a very reasonable lower level math class.
Yes, I liked how it was real world application type math.
It is a gut QR credit. If you have a general understanding of math and just want the credit without putting much time and acquiring much from the class, then take this one.
I would recommend this course to others.
Most likely no. The teachers style is scary for people scared of the QR credit.
I would recommend it as a quantitative reasoning credit.
If they have minimal mathematical knowledge and enjoy applied mathematics I would
i would if someone is looking for a QR credit but is not confident in taking the higher level maths.
Yes, not too hard if you are not a math major
This is a good course for non majors
